result.execSummary:
The defendant Shakila Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: First 7 Months Straight Time, Balance with Huber. Sentence credit of 41 days were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with anyone listed in the criminal complaint or with the Target Store in Menomonee Falls. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Shakila  Stewart in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicole M Masnica.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Court orally amends information regarding repeater enhancer section language, correcting statute number and penalties.  Court orally amends.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Masnica makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court denies Defense's request for expungment.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:  

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

10 MONTHS JAIL -  1st  7 months straight time - remainder with huber (CREDIT - 41 days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: anyone listed in criminal complaint or with Target store in Menomonee Falls
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)
WC inmate communication received today from the Defendant, requesting modification of bail. CC to DA and Atty.
WC jail inmate communication received 06/12/15 from the Defendant, requesting modification of bail. CC to DA and Atty Masnica.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Shakila Stewart in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arraignment to be held before the Judge.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
